comments.content: D for sure. Whitelisting: allow something, *deny everything else*.

discussion.content: It could also be option B, because executable files are always asociated to aplications, right?

choices.A: Allow everything and deny specific executable files.
choices.B: Allow specific executable files and deny specific executable files.
choices.D: Allow specific files and deny everything else.
choices.C: Writing current application attacks on a whiteboard daily.

questions.question_text: Why are reputation filters typically the first filters that are applied to inbound emails in content security systems?

choices.D: to reduce the processing load on other filters by eliminating emails from known bad sources.
choices.A: to remove spam messages, which use SMTP server resources.
choices.B: These filters are the most complicated to run so they are executed first to conserve CPU resources.
choices.C: to reduce the processing load on other filters by eliminating emails from known bad sources.

discussion.content: C & D are the same answers, something isn't right.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. During an analysis, this list of email attachments is found. Which files contain the same content?

discussion.content: correct, because of the same hash value
this is a reply attack, answer is D
